I once debugged a carbureted 383 stroker engine before finishing my coffee — now I mostly debug TypeScript.
I rewired an entire RP server database at 3am because “it felt off.” Fixed five bugs and didn’t even mean to. Now I document everything.
I built my first Discord bot because I refused to use MEE6 — now it’s a framework.
I taught myself Docker just to avoid paying for a hosting panel. That spiraled into a business.
I converted a digital dash to analog in an ’84 Corvette. Writing auth middleware was harder.
